<engine> <!-- This means $('#content .result').html('Hello World: ' + name); the "name" comes from the holy call, you can see on the "script" tab. Inside <template>, we have a trimpath code, you can know on "Trimpath" holy component. Inside <dot>, we have a doT code, you can know on "doT" holy component. --> <template selector="#content .resultTrimpath"> Hello World (Trimpath): ${name} </template> <dot selector="#content .result"> Hello World (doT): {{= it.name}} </dot>
<!-- This works like the selector attribute, but instead of calling the jquery function with a selector, the value must be a jQuery object that the result will be appended --> <template dom="domObjectTrimpath"> Hello World (Trimpath - dom): ${name} </template> <dot dom="domObjectDot"> Hello World (doT - dom): {{= it.name}} </dot>
<!-- This script will run (eval) after the template process and change the DOM. In other words, the order of entries (templates, doTs, scripts, actions) is relevant. --> <script> $('#content .count').val(parseInt($('#content .count').val())+1); </script> <!-- You can put more entries here, like template, action or script to be executed.
<template selector=".whatever"> abc </template> -->
</engine>
